_header: For there beth many oxen heads and bones
Subjects: letters, domestic; instruction, to servants; letters
_description: Instructions of the Mayor of Exeter John Shillingford to his servant, one ‘Germyn’ on removal of oxen heads and bones from the lane beneath ‘Flsssh Folde Yeate’ before arrival, from the Shillingford Letters — three monorhyming lines

Shillingford.Transcription:
for ther lieth many oxen hedes and bonysthat they be removed away for
                    the nonysayenst my comyng as sone as y may by cokkis bonys
Shillingford.Note:
Written as prose, in letter of John Shillingford to his fellows, written
                    at London, ?Nov. or Dec, 1447.
Shillingford.Editions:
Moore,  Stuart A.,
                        ed.  
             Letters and Papers of John Shillingford, Mayor of Exeter
                1447-50.
Camden Society
         n. s. 11. 1871: 23.
